section.title: Assign CORS headers to requests
section.para: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is a specification that defines how browsers and servers communicate across origins by using HTTP headers, such as those assigned by Object Storage API requests. The Object Storage API supports these headers. For more information, see www.w3.org/TR/access-control/.
You can assign these headers to only objects.
